cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 525 mi SE of Lake Charles Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW today, turning NW Wednesday and NNW toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast, on course to cross the coastline near the TX-LA border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron Parish LA–Upper Texas coast (just west of Lake Charles)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Freeport TX to San Luis Pass and from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS, including Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas/Borgne
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline, especially Sabine Lake, Calcasieu Lake, Cameron Parish, Vermilion Bay
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts likely; 64-kt wind probability up to 37% with sustained 50-kt winds possible Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Calcasieu Lake and vicinity could experience 9–13 ft inundation if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 in, isolated 12 in, causing flash/urban flooding and river rises around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas in the ship channel, possible tornadoes in rainbands, prolonged loss of power and navigation aids
